Label: Interball Polar Cap Activity Index, Key Parameters - V.Sergeev  (Institute of physics Univ. of St.-Peterburg St.-Peterburg, Russia )
PiAffiliation: Institute of physics Univ. of St.-Peterburg St.-Peterburg, Russia

VariableDescription.Name: PC_Vostok
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Southern Polar Cap magnetic activity index, 'Vostok'
VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         ISTP>International Solar-Terrestrial Physics
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     INTERBALL-GROUND>Ground Based Data
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter
#     DESCRIPTOR                      PCI>PC Geomagnetic Index
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     TITLE                           Polar Cap Activity Index
#     TEXT                            References:     1.Troshichev O.A. et al, Planet.Space Sci.,   36, 1095, 1988.
#                                     2.Vennerstrom S. et al,  Report UAG-103, World Data Center A for STP, Boulder,                         
#                                      April 1994                                                                                            
#     MODS                            created Mar 1996
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0250
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 IG_K0_PCI_00000000_V01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  IG_K0_PCI
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Interball Polar Cap Activity Index, Key Parameters
#     PI_NAME                         V.Sergeev
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  Institute of physics Univ. of St.-Peterburg St.-Peterburg, Russia
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Interball
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Ground-Based Magnetometers, Riometers, Sounders
#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT_1               PC-index is an empirical magnetic activity index based on data from single near-pole                   
#                                      station (Thule or Vostok for N or S hemispheres, respectively).                                       
#                                     Its derivation procedure is optimized to achieve the best correlation of  PC-index                     
#                                      with the solar wind electric field (SWEF) magnitude ( v*B*sin(teta/2)**2 ).                           
#                                     The averaged horizontal magnetic disturbance vector (quiet  value subtracted)                          
#                                      is projected onto the optimal direction (defined  empirically for each UT hour                        
#                                      and each season based on the best correlation  with the SWEF) and, after normalization                
#                                      to the equivalent value  of SWEF, it gives the PC-index (expressed in mV/m).                          
#                                     Although PC-index is  formally expressed in mV/m, it actually represents the                           
#                                       measure of magnetic activity, the normalization procedure (to SWEF)  helps                           
#                                      to reduce the seasonal/diurnal effects to facilitate the intercomparison.                             
#                                     The resolution of the northern cap PC-index is 5 min and of the one from southern                      
#                                      cap - 15 min. However, one time scale with the 5 min step is used for both                            
#                                      indices and each  15 min averaged value of southern index is, hence, repeated                         
#                                      for three times.                                                                                      
#                                     Full description: http://www.iki.rssi.ru/interball.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Interball-Ground_PCI_Key-Parameters-K0_cdf
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 22:47:44 2015

#     TEXT_SUPPLEMENT_1               PC-index is an empirical magnetic activity index based on data from single near-pole                   
#                                      station (Thule or Vostok for N or S hemispheres, respectively).                                       
#                                     Its derivation procedure is optimized to achieve the best correlation of  PC-index                     
#                                      with the solar wind electric field (SWEF) magnitude ( v*B*sin(teta/2)**2 ).                           
#                                     The averaged horizontal magnetic disturbance vector (quiet  value subtracted)                          
#                                      is projected onto the optimal direction (defined  empirically for each UT hour                        
#                                      and each season based on the best correlation  with the SWEF) and, after normalization                
#                                      to the equivalent value  of SWEF, it gives the PC-index (expressed in mV/m).                          
#                                     Although PC-index is  formally expressed in mV/m, it actually represents the                           
#                                       measure of magnetic activity, the normalization procedure (to SWEF)  helps                           
#                                      to reduce the seasonal/diurnal effects to facilitate the intercomparison.                             
#                                     The resolution of the northern cap PC-index is 5 min and of the one from southern                      
#                                      cap - 15 min. However, one time scale with the 5 min step is used for both                            
#                                      indices and each  15 min averaged value of southern index is, hence, repeated                         
#                                      for three times.                                                                                      
#                                     Full description: http://www.iki.rssi.ru/interball.html
